intro: Machaerium tobagense, commonly known as the Toba machaerium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
